quoteFirst: "He called the lawyer on the telephone at twenty minutes past two and said he would go at once to his office. If he had done so, he would have arrived there at
quoteLast: . He reached there, in fact, at two-fifty, ten minutes of three. A half-hour of his time isn't accounted for. He left the hotel at two-twenty-one.
title: The Winning Clue
author: Hay, James, 1881-1936

quoteFirst: ; daybreak at 2:44 a. m., and end of twilight at 9:09 p. m.; and on the 31st, sun rises at 4:37 a. m., and sets at 7:17 p. m.; daybreak occurs
quoteLast: , and twilight ends 9:30 p. m. During the month the days increase in length some fifty minutes.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, May 1884, No. 8
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
